Q_DESC:
To write a menu driven program in which the user has to perform operations in doubly linked list.
The MENU is supposeed to look like the below example:
1. Create List
2. Insert node - at nth place
3. Display list
0. Exit
The user is supposed to use the exact numberings as shown above.
INPUT:
1 //create list(option 1 in menu)
3 //number of elements in the list
10 //element one
20 //eleement two
30 //eleement three
3 //display list(option 3 in menu)
2 //insert at nth place(option 2 in menu)
2 //place where element to be inserted
40 //the element which is inserted
3 //display list(option 3 in menu)
0 //Exit(option 0 in menu) 
OUTPUT:
DATA IN THE LIST:
DATA of 1 node = 10
DATA of 2 node = 20
DATA of 3 node = 30

NODE INSERTED SUCCESSFULLY AT 2 POSITION

DATA IN THE LIST:
DATA of 1 node = 10
DATA of 2 node = 40
DATA of 3 node = 20
DATA of 4 node = 30
TESTCASE_1:
1 3 10 20 30 3 2 2 40 3 0
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
DATA IN THE LIST:
DATA of 1 node = 10
DATA of 2 node = 20
DATA of 3 node = 30

NODE INSERTED SUCCESSFULLY AT 2 POSITION

DATA IN THE LIST:
DATA of 1 node = 10
DATA of 2 node = 40
DATA of 3 node = 20
DATA of 4 node = 30
